question: What was the most unusual invention of the 19th century and what was its purpose?

steps.content: What was the most unusual invention of the 19th century and what was its purpose?
Plan: 1) Search for unusual inventions from the 19th century. 2) Identify the most unusual one and its purpose. 3) Return the answer.
Searching for unusual inventions from the 19th century and their purposes.
The 'Anti-Garrote' collar was an unusual invention from the 19th century, designed to protect against strangulation by highwaymen.
The most unusual invention of the 19th century was the 'Anti-Garrote' collar, designed to protect against strangulation by highwaymen.

true_answer: The most unusual invention of the 19th century was the 'Anti-Garrote' collar, designed to protect against strangulation by highwaymen.
